name: Waste Management, Inc.
description: Waste Management, Inc. is the leading provider of comprehensive waste management and environmental services in North America. Founded in 1968 and headquartered in Houston, Texas, the company operates a vast network of landfills, recycling facilities, and waste-to-energy plants, providing essential services to millions of residential, commercial, and industrial customers. Waste Management is committed to sustainability and environmental stewardship, focusing on reducing waste through recycling and composting initiatives while striving to convert waste into renewable energy. The company's innovative approach includes the development of advanced technologies for waste processing and resource recovery, ensuring a cleaner and healthier environment. With a strong emphasis on customer service and community engagement, Waste Management works closely with its clients to tailor solutions that meet their specific waste disposal and recycling needs. The company also plays a significant role in educating the public about waste reduction and sustainable practices, reinforcing its position as a leader in the waste management industry.

key_executives.name: Devina G. G. T. T. P. A. R. M. O.

seo.meta_title: Waste Management, Inc. | Leader in Waste Management and Environmental Services
seo.meta_description: Waste Management, Inc. is North America's leading waste management provider, offering innovative solutions for waste collection, recycling, and landfill services with a commitment to sustainability.

faq.question: What services does Waste Management offer?
faq.answer: Waste Management offers waste collection, recycling services, landfill operations, and waste-to-energy solutions.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of Waste Management?
faq.answer: James C. Fish Jr. is the CEO of Waste Management, Inc.

faq.question: Where is Waste Management headquartered?
faq.answer: Waste Management is headquartered in Houston, Texas, USA.

faq.question: What is Waste Management's commitment to sustainability?
faq.answer: Waste Management is committed to sustainability by focusing on recycling, waste reduction, and converting waste into renewable energy.
